snippet: With only six weeks to go before the formal unveiling of a new set of leaders, Communist Party elders are still deciding on who will ascend to the top ruling bodies.
abstract: Chinese Communist Party elders and senior officials, reeling from year of internal scandals, are still deciding who will ascend to the top ruling bodies with only six weeks before the formal unveiling of a new set of leaders for the country (Series: Changing of the Guard).

byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and JONATHAN ANSFIELD

lead_paragraph: With only six weeks to go before the formal unveiling of a new set of leaders, Communist Party elders are still deciding on who will ascend to the top ruling bodies.

headline.print_headline: With a Transition Near, New Questions in China
headline.seo: Chinese Communist Party Still Unsettled Over Changes
headline.main: With a Transition Near, New Questions in China
